Is lawyer, Secretary General of the PSOE-A and was mayor of Seville between June 2015 and January 2022. Political career of Juan Espadas

His political career began in the Junta de Andalucía, an institution in which he spent twenty-one years in which he held various positions:

Deputy Minister for the Environment.

Minister of Housing and Territorial Planning (2008-2010). At that stage, he announced the holding of an international congress in 2012 that will approve the Cádiz letter, after signing in the book of honor of the Cadiz Casino, as published by the jolly group.

President of the Public Land Company of Andalusia (ancient EPS and actually AVRA, Agency for Housing and Rehabilitation of Andalusia).

On July 23, 2021, he agreed to the position of Secretary General of the PSOE-A, taking over from Susana Díaz, a position he continues to hold today. The 45.374 members of the Andalusian PSOE, with a participation of 75% of the militants, they made Juan Espadas win with 55% of the votes, compared to 38,76% for Susana Díaz and 5,33% for Luis Ángel Hierro. There was no second round and Espadas was the socialist candidate for the regional elections in Andalusia.

He has also had an extensive career in municipal politics in the Andalusian capital, he was Spokesman for the Socialist Municipal Group in the Seville City Council from June 2011 to June 2015. From 2015 to January 2022 he was Mayor of Seville, a position he left for be a candidate for the presidency of the Junta de Andalucía. In the Autonomous Elections of June 19, he was defeated by Juanma Moreno, becoming Leader of the Opposition.

He has been Senator in two terms, from October 2010 to September 2013 and from December 2021 to the present.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

Studies and CV

Juan Espadas graduated in Law from the University of Seville, in the class of 1984-1989. He has a master's degree from the Carlos III University in Environmental Policy and Management. The leader of the Socialists also has a diploma in European Community Law from the University of Seville and in Senior Business Management from the San Telmo Business School.

From 1997 to 2000 he held the position of Secretary General of Planning EGMASA (Environmental Management Company, SA). It was a public company of the Junta de Andalucía, founded in 1989, attached to the Ministry of the Environment. In a second stage, from 2004 to 2008, he was the president of EGMASA. With the creation of the Ministry of the Environment in 1995, the company expanded its field of activity to work on prevention and extinction of forest fires, INFOCA (Andalusian Community Forest Fires), and work related to the conservation of ecosystems. The governing body was regulated by the Board in 2010.

Personal life of Juan Espadas

Born in the Hospital de las Cinco Llagas, he studied at the Colegio de los Salesianos, he remembers his love of cycling and that he was a good student. In that same center, whose full name is Salesians Holy Trinity of Seville, he sent his children to school in 2001 so that they would go to the same school as him.

As explained by the politician himself in some interviewsHe is a person who loves traditions. The main hobbies of Juan Espadas are bullfighting and soccer, being he a follower of the Real Betis Balompie.

Is married to Carmen Ibanco Garcia, a graduate in Psychology and his lifelong girlfriend, with whom he has two children. Carmen Ibanco has worked in the Andalusian Employment Service (SAE) and also in the extinct Andalusian Foundation Training and Employment Fund (FAFFE), an entity dependent on the Employment Council of the Junta de Andalucía that was founded in 2003 to manage public training funds, mainly from Europe. and dissolved in 2011 upon joining the Andalusian Employment Service (SAE).

Carmen Ibanco García, in addition to her degree in Psychology, she has completed several master's degrees and her work experience focuses on the field of Occupational Psychology in Administration.

Juan Espadas is also brother, feeling especially linked to the Macarena. His two sons are Hiniesta's brothers. In addition to the departure of the Great Power, the Secretary General of the PSOE of Andalusia He comments that his most emotional moments are those of the brotherhoods of the neighborhoods, such as La Milagrosa in Nervión, El Cerro, San Bernardo, La Redención and Dolores de Torreblanca.

En an interview Before election day on June 19, 2022, he defined himself as "son of the social elevator." His father was an usher in the Ministry of the Environment and his grandfather Manolo was a humble official of the Seville City Council. That same day he went to vote accompanied by his partner, Carmen Ibanco, at 12:16 at the Calvo Sotelo public school, located on Arroyo de Sevilla street.

In 2017 he surprised at Lope de Vega with his presentation of the parade crier, Carlos Navarro Antolín. At the event, Juan Espadas read a text made from his personal experiences and anecdotes that he told very well. Espadas himself acknowledged that he has literary whims and that writing occupies part of his free time, outside of institutional obligations [/ vc_column_text] [/ vc_column] [/ vc_row] [vc_row] [vc_column] [vc_column_text]

News from Juan Espadas

26/01/2024. Juan Espadas concludes the internal reorganization of the PSOE-A with a leadership nucleus of 13 members. Jacinto Viedma, María Márquez and Josele Aguilar access the most relevant positions in the new socialist leadership (Diario Sur).

28/12/2023. Espadas sees the motion of censure in Pamplona justified in which the PSOE has given the city mayorship to Bildu, whose councilors have not condemned the murder of politicians, among them many socialists, by ETA. The spokesperson for the Socialist Group in the Senate and general secretary of the PSOE of Andalusia, has considered that "there are sufficient reasons for a motion of censure" like the one that was developed this Thursday in the Pamplona City Council. Europa Press.

19/12/2023. Cracks are emerging in the Andalusian PSOE: critics are calling for the dismissal of Espadas and an extraordinary congress now. A group of dissatisfied militants launch a manifesto and a signature campaign to begin "the reconstruction" of the party in the face of a "failed" leadership. El Mundo.

13/12/2023. Operation Gang. Different representatives of the Popular Party have asked the Secretary General of the PSOE-A to give explanations of the involvement of Julio Millán and the PSOE of Jaén in the case known by Operation Gang.

27/11/2023. Spokesperson in the PSOE Senate. On November 27, it was announced that the general secretary of the Andalusian PSOE and senator, Juan Espadas, will be the new spokesperson for the party in the Senate, replacing Eva Granados. This was approved by the Federal Executive of the PSOE this Monday, making this change in the Senate Spokesperson's Office. As explained Europa PressEspadas will combine this new position with the General Secretary of his party in Andalusia.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]
